amendatorysection.para: Each grain dealer or his or her agent upon taking possession of grain from a seller shall issue a receipt to the seller or his or her agent. Such receipt shall show: (1) The date and time of day the grain dealer or his or her agent took possession of the seller's grain; (2) the name and address of the buyer; (3) the name of the seller; (4) the name of the agent; (5) the motor vehicle license plate number of any vehicle used by the grain dealer or his or her agent in taking possession of the seller's grain; (6) the kind of grain delivered to the buyer; (7) the approximate quantity of grain delivered to the buyer; and (8) the provisions of section 75-905. The receipt shall be in such form as the Public Service Commission may by rule and regulation require.

annotation.para: A buyer's failure to give the seller a proper receipt as required by this section does not render null and void the time requirements of section 75-905 to preserve a claim against the buyer's security pursuant to section 75-906. Fecht v. The Bunnell Co., 243 Neb. 1, 497 N.W.2d 50 (1993).
